metadata.title: Secondary Household Transmission of SARS, Singapore EMERGENCE OF SARS

abstract.original_text: Secondary household transmission of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) was studied in 114 households involving 417 contacts. The attack rate was low (6.2%). Occupation of the index case was the factor that most influenced household transmission (adjusted hazard ratio for healthcare workers 0.157; 95% confidence interval 0.042 to 0.588).

sentences.segment_text: Secondary household transmission of severe acute respiratory syndrome ( SARS ) was studied in 114 households involving 417 contacts .
Occupation of the index case was the factor that most influenced household transmission ( adjusted hazard ratio for healthcare workers 0.157 ; 95 % confidence interval 0.042 to 0.588 ) .
